definition: to break/to snap/to cut off/to give up or abstain from sth/to judge/(usu. used in the negative) absolutely/definitely/decidedly

sentences.english: Blade all trapped in floor, off the water DuanLiang, disappointment extremely.
sentences.chinese: 刀鋒衆人困於樓中，斷水斷糧，失望至極。

sentences.english: We shall wait the enemy out, and watch them starve.
sentences.chinese: 我們將按兵不動，等着敵人斷糧捱餓。

sentences.english: There were times during the war when his entire school had no rice to eat.
sentences.chinese: 在抗戰時期，他的學校經常斷糧。

sentences.english: Soon there would be no food in the city, they said.
sentences.chinese: 他們說城裏很快就會斷糧了。

definition: lit. to return the jade annulus to Zhao (idiom); fig. to return something intact to its rightful owner
Kaesong or Gaeseong city in southwest North Korea, close to the border with South Korea and a special economic zone for South Korean companies
no way out/nowhere to go/trapped beyond hope of rescue/painted into a corner
seize every minute and second (idiom); not a minute to lose/every moment counts
to beat sb at their own game (idiom)
after the calamity, renewed life (idiom); new lease of life
to whine on for days (idiom)/to endlessly grumble complaints/incessant whining

Feast at Hongmen/(fig.) banquet set up with the aim of murdering a guest/refers to a famous episode in 206 BC when future Han emperor Liu Bang 劉邦|刘邦[Liu2 Bang1] escaped attempted murder by his rival Xiang Yu 項羽|项羽[Xiang4 Yu3]
